ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: An in-depth knowledge and analysis of many important topics in law/politics specifically dealing with the topic of race. I really enjoyed the history of discrimination in the US.
Insights into American law and the history of discrimination in the US.
Learned the history of discrimination court cases
good
Detailed understanding of law and economics surrounding the foundations and history of discrimination.
I learned a lot about how to approach legal documents and court cases.

I developed an understanding of the laws and court cases surrounding discrimination in the U.S. I developed the skills to assess and analyze and interpret laws in different ways. There was a lot of new and very interesting information!

I learned so much about discrimination law, including its legal foundation, common law, and how to apply it in the future. Additionally, we learned the game theory implementation of some discrimination theory.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Some of the weeks the material covered did not lend well for debate or discussion and effectively became a small lecture style course. I would have preferred more engagement from students.
My weakness was my inability to do better then 9.25/10 on the homeworks. I wish I had more resources to know what made a A homework assignment.
Great class. Easy senior seminar
good
I really enjoyed the mock trial, and I liked the Professors idea of doing 2 but other than that I really enjoyed how this course was set up.
I thought the course was very good and taught in a very engaging manner
Strengths would be the discussions and also I thought the lecture notes were really really helpful.

I think the lecture notes and Professor Jaynes are a massive strength. The course is interesting due to the discussion Professor Jaynes leads, and he is such a great person. The weakness would be that Professor Jaynes has one very specific answer in mind for the writing assignments, so it can be challenging to meet his exact expectation.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely, especially ECON majors.

Absolutely. It's a pretty relaxed and highly enjoyable course, perfect for a senior econ seminar. Professor Jaynes is a gem man. Fount of wisdom. His life is unbelievably fascinating. Take it for him alone.
good
Yes. Definitely really enjoyed this course and think others should take it.
Yes. Prof Jaynes has great stories.
Yes! I learned a lot.
I would recommend this class. It is such a helpful topic to learn. However, the debate is highly dependent on who is in your class.
Yes best class Ive ever taken at Yale
